summary: Email correspondence between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and attorneys for the Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein. The email confirms that the Estate's Co-Executors will not retaliate against employees who cooperate with law enforcement, will not make distributions to Ghislaine Maxwell without prior notice during her criminal proceedings, and will not waive attorney-client privilege at this time.

persons.name: Strauss, Audrey
persons.context: Named as a recipient in the email chain, appears to be a U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Weinstein, Marc A.
persons.role: Partner, Chair of White Collar Defense at Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP, attorney for the Co-Executors of the Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Author of the response letter on behalf of the Co-Executors of Jeffrey Epstein's Estate, confirming their positions regarding employee cooperation, distributions to Ghislaine Maxwell, and privilege waivers.

persons.name: Andrew Tomback
persons.role: Attorney (likely with the U.S. Attorney's Office)
persons.context: Named as a recipient in the email chain, appears to be involved in the SDNY's investigation correspondence.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Deceased individual whose estate is being administered by Co-Executors; the subject of the SDNY investigation and related trust matters.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of a criminal proceeding in the Southern District of New York; the Co-Executors confirm they will notify the USAO in advance of any disbursement to her from the trust during her pending case.

connections.description: Weinstein is acting as legal counsel for the Co-Executors of Jeffrey Epstein's Estate.
Maxwell is an associate of Epstein and a potential beneficiary of his trust; her criminal proceedings are pending.
Weinstein, on behalf of the Estate's Co-Executors, confirms they will notify the USAO before any disbursement to Maxwell during her criminal case.
Both appear to be attorneys with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York involved in the Epstein investigation correspondence.

events.title: SDNY Letter to Epstein Estate Attorneys
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York sends a letter to the attorneys for the Epstein Estate regarding their investigation.

events.title: Estate's Response to SDNY
events.description: Marc A. Weinstein, on behalf of the Co-Executors of Jeffrey Epstein's Estate, responds to the SDNY's letter, confirming their positions on non-retaliation, distributions to Ghislaine Maxwell, and privilege waivers.

locations: United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The Co-Executors of Jeffrey Epstein's Estate confirm they will not use trust provisions to retaliate against employees who cooperate with law enforcement investigations.
The Co-Executors agree to notify the U.S. Attorney's Office in advance of any disbursement to Ghislaine Maxwell during the pendency of her criminal proceedings in the SDNY.
The Co-Executors are not prepared to waive attorney-client privilege or other applicable privileges regarding materials seized by the Government.
The correspondence indicates ongoing investigation and oversight by the SDNY into Epstein's estate and its potential beneficiaries, particularly Ghislaine Maxwell.
The document references 'The 1953 Trust,' indicating a trust structure potentially holding Epstein's assets.
